intro: Hibiscus urbanii, commonly known as the Chinese hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink and red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and thrives in warm, humid climates. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Hibiscus urbanii is also valued for its ability to purify air and attract pollinators.
